alert.note: Alert for Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 12 at 2:35AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following area, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 AM MDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Drainages may become clogged with debris. Recent wildfire burn scars will be more susceptible to dangerous flash flooding, including the Bear Trap and Black Burn Scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous showers and thunderstorms will develop this afternoon with stronger storms producing rain at rates over 1 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
